headline.main: World Briefing | The Americas: Guatemala: Assassination Witness Stabbed

lead_paragraph: A witness who helped convict three Guatemalan military men for the assasination of a crusading bishop was stabbed and injured while in prison, Amnesty International said. Gilberto Gómez Limón, in prison on an unrelated charge, was stabbed by someone with easy access to his cell, the rights group said. The three military men are appealing their conviction earlier this year for the murder of Bishop Juan José Gerardi, who was bludgeoned to death after he issued a report that blamed the military for most of the murders and atrocities during Guatemala's 36-year civil war. David Gonzalez (NYT)
abstract: Witness who helped convict three Guatemalan military men in murder of Bishop Juan Jose Gerardi is injured by stabbing in prison (S)
